title: UPDATED FOR NEW HUD - [How To] Opting In to DJ Sona's Music!
body:
Hey guys! 

I've seen a lot of posts asking how to opt in to DJ Sona's music experience, so I wanted to give a quick how-to to eliminate some confusion! 

**If you're playing  as DJ Sona**, you won't have to do anything, and you'll automatically be opted in to the experience. 


**If you're on the same team as a DJ Sona, you'll need to opt in!**

* Hold tab to bring up the scoreboard. 
* On the scoreboard, you'll see a music note to the left/right (depending on your team) of Sona's portrait.
http://imgur.com/8HKEvVR
* Click the button to opt in to DJ Sona's music. You can also click the button again to opt out. 


**If you're not on DJ Sona's team**, you won't be able to opt in to hear her music.

*Side note: Make sure your in-game music is turned on, as it's tied to DJ Sona's music!*

replies.body: Is there any particular reason it was put there as opposed to on the scoreboard or somewhere else with a precedent?  It seems odd, from an interface perspective, to put the music icon in a location that is far enough from the main interactive tab menu and small enough to be easily missed or mistaken for terrain in the split second the tab menu is open.
I also think that if you have to bring up the scoreboard to bring up the button... it should be on the scoreboard that you are currently holding tab to bring up. Much more intuitive.
Exactly my point, yes.

This might be a silly idea, but is there a way we could opt into an OPPONENT Sona's beats?  It does pose the idea that SOME Sona (somewhere) might coordinate with her team using music, but... I honestly don't think that it's really a thing.  It being a legendary skin, why not give it maximum exposure?

It's worth noting that the music changes slightly when Sona casts a spell. This means that an enemy who opted in to Sona's music would get a very small amount of information they otherwise wouldn't. In a worst case this could potentially even give away a Baron sneak.
Enemies are unable to opt in to DJ Sona's music.

Just a question: Is there any particular reason why the music is opt in in the first place, rather than opt out? I'm asking because the first month or so after the skin was released I didn't even realize you had to opt in, and after someone finally told me, I still simply forget it in most cases since it's a small button hidden somewhere on the HUD that is only there every 10 or 20 games. I've asked some of the people I play with about it, and they told me pretty much the same: they either didn't know about it, or constantly forgot to actually press it.
I would have understoof it during the initial flood of the skin in every game, but now that this has died down, I feel that opt out with a more obviously placed button would be a much better choice. As it stands, I think a huge part of the community misses out on a lot of the work that went into the skin not because they want to, but because what they have to do in order to experience it is pretty terribly communicated to them.(If you won't consider making it opt out, maybe at least add a loading screen tip that says "hey you can op in to hear sonas music" when the skin is present in the game?

When you load into the game, there's a pop up on the lower right hand side that lets you know you can/how to opt into DJ Sona's music when there is one in your game - it's similar to ARAM and the rules popping up about not being able to return to base to shop. 

We felt that rather than forcing people to hear DJ Sona's music, it was a better to give players a choice to opt in if they wanted to.
I posted that as a response to the post above, I was never suggesting that they could.
Although she's an ultimate skin, we can't do this since there are scenarios where they may be a Sona on both teams. :]

More accurately:

Spend $20 to let my four companions listen to a different track in-game that also gives me headaches.

It is simple logic in my mind: I actually love the soundtrack used for SR by default, and the DJ Sona themes are something I sometimes want to opt out of despite actually wanting to play Sona.

So to reiterate my logic on that line:

a) I want to play Sona
b) My teammates would prefer I use the DJ Sona skin so that their experience is more enjoyable
c) If I do as they request, I will likely get a headache
d) I'd like to play DJ Sona and simultaneously not be listening to her theme skin music so I can avoid getting a headache while also making my team happy.
Her music is tied to the in game music slider, so you can turn that down and not hear it. :]

Hmm. I meant "can I opt out of hearing DJ Sona's music while playing DJ Sona and instead hear the soundtrack that would play if I didn't".

So I assume the answer to *that* question is a resounding no. :C
Well, you could just pull it up on YouTube and have it running in the background. But that's a bit of an extra hassle, I know.

> [{quoted}](name=NicaKnight,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=0AQTKJI1,comment-id=0003000000000000,timestamp=2015-03-18T07:56:03.304+0000)
>
> Well, you could just pull it up on YouTube and have it running in the background. But that's a bit of an extra hassle, I know.

Well... here's a list of problems with that.

a) Internet speed is not reliable enough for simultaneously doing both playing and listening.
b) The in-game music dynamically adjusts itself based on actions being taken. It'd be basically impossible to know (as well as an extra large hassle) which pieces of the music to play.
c) The in-game music *seems* to be constructed on the fly from multiple different audio files that then are overlapped.
